description: A response represents an HTTP response.
title: Response

___text.description: The raw text of the response.

___time.description: The time taken by the request to complete.

___name.description: Since it is rather hard to keep track of what a number means, responses can have a Human-friendly string describing the response code.

___code.description: Each HTTP response has a numeric response code (explained in [rfc-2616](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html). This code is stored in this field by Postman.

___detail.description: Detailed explanation about the response code goes here.

items.description: A Cookie, that follows the [Google Chrome format](https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/cookies)
items.title: Cookie

___name.description: This is the name of the Cookie.

___httpOnly.description: Indicates if this cookie is HTTP Only. (if True, the cookie is inaccessible to client-side scripts)

___session.description: True if the cookie is a session cookie.

___hostOnly.description: True if the cookie is a host-only cookie. (i.e. a request's URL domain must exactly match the domain of the cookie).

___expirationDate.description: The timestamp of the time when the cookie expires.

___secure.description: Indicates if the 'secure' flag is set on the Cookie, meaning that it is transmitted over secure connections only. (typically HTTPS)

___storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store containing this cookie.

___domain.description: The domain for which this cookie is valid.

___path.description: The path associated with the Cookie.

___name.description: Some headers can have names associated with them, which are stored in this field.

___description.description: An optional description about the header.

___key.description: The left hand side (LHS) or 'key' of the header.

___value.description: Value of the header, or the right hand side (RHS).

___rawDataType.description: The data type of the raw response.
